AvailabilityZone.notes: Specifies the name of the Availability Zone the instance is located in.

DisableApiTermination.notes: Boolean indicating whether the instance can be terminated through the API.

ImageId.notes: Provides the unique ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) that was assigned during registration.

KeyName.notes: Provides the name of the EC2 key pair.

Monitoring.notes: Whether monitoring is enabled for the instance.

PlacementGroupName.notes: The name of an existing placement group you want to launch the intstance into (for cluster instances).

PrivateIpAddress.notes: If you're using Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, you can optionally use this parameter to assign the instance a specific available IP address from the subnet (e.g., 10.0.0.25). Default: Amazon VPC selects an IP address from the subnet for the instance.

RamDiskId.notes: The ID of the RAM disk to select. Some kernels require additional drivers at launch. Check the kernel requirements for information on whether you need to specify a RAM disk. To find kernel requirements, refer to the AWS Resource Center and search for the kernel ID.

SecurityGroups.notes: Valid only for EC2 security groups. A list containing the EC2 security groups to assign to the Amazon EC2 instance. The list can contain both the name of existing EC2 security groups or references to AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup resources created in the template.

SecurityGroupIds.notes: Required for VPC security groups. A list containing the security group IDs for VPC security groups to assign to the Amazon EC2 instance.

SubnetId.notes: If you're using Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, this specifies the ID of the subnet you want to launch the instance into.

Tags.notes: The tags you want to attach to the instance.

UserData.notes: Base64-encoded MIME user data made available to the instances.

Volumes.notes: The EBS volumes to attach to the instance.
